turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Hello. Good afternoon.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Hiya.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Hi there. This is Doctor <UNIN/>, from GP at Hand.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Hi there. My name's <UNSURE>Atan</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Hi <UNSURE>Anthony</UNSURE>. So, could I have your um, before we start, could I have your full name and date of birth? If that's possible?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Sure. So, it's <UNSURE>Ayrton Warren</UNSURE>. Um, and my date of birth, is the sixteenth of May, nineteen, eighty two.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: That's <UNIN/>, thank you for that. Are you in a private place where you're OK to speak?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I am, yes.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, great. So how can I help you today?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, so I kind of woke up this morning, um, and I've just got this, really horrible pain on the left side of my head. Um, a real kind of headachy feeling.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Sure, OK. And, um, uh, <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>, did the, did the pain wake you up?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, it woke me up, um, quite early this morning.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: What, what time did it wake you up?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, probably around, five thirty ish.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And, what time do you normally get up?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, I normally get up at about, seven o'clock.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Is the headache still present now?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes, it is.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. <UNSURE>Have</UNSURE> you had this kind of pain before?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, I mean uh, I've, had a bit of a history with headaches, but nothing as severe as this before.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: So they were less severe. Were they similar in nature in terms of being one-sided and the type of pain?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, not so much on the one side, it tends to be, a bit of a cluster at the front of my head in a way. Um, but this time it's just kind of more prominent on the left side which, I've never really had it, normally they kind of spread across the front of my head.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, all right. And, um, can I just double-check, do you have any neck stiffness at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, no.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. And do you have any fever?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: All right. Um, how are you with bright lights at the moment? Do you feel sensitive to bright lights or can you, can you tolerate them <UNSURE>all right</UNSURE>, OK?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, it, I'm a little bit sensitive it just, it kind of, makes my eyes a little bit sore, but nothing that I can't really handle.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. And, can I just double-check, um, are you feeling nauseous at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, not really, like <UNIN/>. When I first got up this morning, my head felt a bit dizzy, but that's kind of subsided now, and I, seems to, be fine.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Um, and um, can I just double-check, does anyone in your family have any migraines or anything like that? They've been diagnosed with migraines?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, no. They haven't.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Um, and um, are you under any particular stress at the moment?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, work's kind of, um, a bit stressful at the moment. I've got a lot going on.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, yeah, I just seem to have like, a lot of, kind of, a backlog of work that I need to go through at the moment. So, I've kind of, been, doing a lot of late nights as well.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, OK. Um, and, um, how long has that been the case for?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, <UNSURE>for</UNSURE> probably about a couple of months now.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/>, how would you say your mood is?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, I'm not, like moody, I'm not angry or, um, like I get a bit frustrated during the day. Um, but <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>, it kind of, um, ebbs and flows every now and then, but, yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Do you have, have you ever been <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> diagnosed with anxiety, or depression or stress in the past?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, I've had, um, so I had, like anxiety for about, two years now, and I've been on, uh, Sertraline for, a while.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Are you taking <UNSURE>Sertraline</UNSURE> at the moment?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Um, and how do you feel in terms of <UNIN/>, anxiety at the moment? Do you feel anxious at the moment?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNIN/>, no, not necessarily at work, sometimes I do feel a bit anxious. Um, but I, I kind of just, uh, the panic of not being able to get my work done on time.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, but other than that, I, I don't, feel, um, massively anxious.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, all right. Um, now, sorry to ask this, just need to ask this for <UNIN/>, anyone suffering from <UNSURE>anxiety</UNSURE>. <UNSURE>Do you have any</UNSURE> <UNIN/>, have you had any thoughts about harming yourself or hurting yourself?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>Good</UNSURE>, I'm glad to hear that. Um, now, with regards to this headache. Is it worse when you lie down, or um, is, is, is it better when you lie down?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, when I lay down, like, uh, it kind of feels a little bit sore at first, um and it takes me a while to get comfortable. Um, so yeah, at the beginning it does, but then again that's just kind of, um, <UNSURE>soothes</UNSURE> a little bit.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, so, would you say ultimately, it's better when you lie down? Or have you not <UNIN/>?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, yeah, I would say so.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Um, and um, in terms of um, this, headache since this morning, have you taken anything for it yet?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, I've taken some Paracetamol.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Has that helped?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, not really, no.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Taking anything else at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No that's it, just Paracetamol.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Um, do you have any other illnesses at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, none.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Have you ever been diagnosed with high blood pressure?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Have you ever had your blood pressure checked?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Um, and are there any illnesses in your family?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, no, there's nothing. My parents, uh, my mum's had a history of anxiety as well but, no kind of like physical illnesses or anything like that.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, all right. And um, are you on any medication?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, no, other, other than Sertraline and having taken, um, Paracetamol this morning, uh, nothing else.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Do you have any allergies to any medication?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Not that I'm aware of, no.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: All right. And, are you living by yourself at the moment, or living with someone else?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, I live with my partner.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Are you a smoker?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. And, uh, do you have any pets at home?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, I have a cat.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. And, can I just double-check, how much exercise would you do normally a week?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, so normally I, try to go running at least three times a week.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And what's your diet like?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, it's OK, um, it's nothing, <UNSURE>it's</UNSURE> nothing <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> um, really healthy, um, but it's fine.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I <UNSURE>wouldn't say</UNSURE> unhealthy.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: All right. Um, now um, in terms of this headache, uh, obviously I haven't been able to examine you, or see you directly.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: But, um, it sounds like it might be one of two things. It could be an element of what we call tension headache.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>OK</UNSURE>. That's one possibility. Um, and what makes that, more likely is the fact that, you've been under some pressure, and you have a history of anxiety in the past, OK. Um.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: The other possibility is, um, migraine as well.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Um, and, the fact, what makes that more likely is the fact that it's on one side, and that you've got some sensitivity to light.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, So, what, what I think we can do, is um, I think we can give you some, um, generic, pain relief.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: That would be the appropriate first step, for, migraine type headaches. OK. So I'll tell you <UNSURE>what it is</UNSURE> in a second.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And the other thing that I was gonna suggest is, we maybe look, explore things to try and decrease the stress from work.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: So, um, the medication-wise, the <UNSURE>things</UNSURE> that we'd start off first <UNSURE>line</UNSURE>, if someone had migraine was to, would be to start Ibuprofen.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And um, uh, <UNSURE>that</UNSURE>, the doses of Ibuprofen can be a bit, more than the normal doses Ibuprofen so that's one thing we can start. You can keep on taking Paracetamol as well if you like, but the, the Ibuprofen's um, actually more effective <UNIN/>, for migraine.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And, um, yeah, so the, the guidelines have changed, recently we used, we, before that we used to give Paracetamol as first line but now it's, um, Ibuprofen or Aspirin.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Ohh right, <UNSURE>O</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: That's, <UNIN/> thing. Um, the other thing I'd like you to do, is maybe consider taking some time off work. OK, because if the headache is due to stress from work.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, maybe having a week off if you self-certify, that might help with things. And I'd also like you to explore, counselling options as well so there's, a counselling service in your area, that I can give you the link for, for you to self-refer.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: I'd like you <UNSURE>to</UNSURE>, <UNIN/>, OK I'd like you to try that. Um, what, we're gonna do is, we'll have a follow-up in a week's time.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, that'd <UNSURE>be</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: As well as those two things, other things I'd like you to do, is to try and ensure that you're having a minimum of seven, eight hours sleep at night, every night. <UNSURE>And you're drinking a</UNSURE> minimum of, um, one point five to two litres uh, of water or fluids a day, and that's not including coffee or tea.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: All right, because sometimes dehydration and you know uh, fatigue can be causes of headaches as well. Um.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Ohh <UNSURE>OK</UNSURE>, I didn't realise that.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Yeah, so <UNSURE>it</UNSURE>, that, that, that is um, you know, we need to rule those things out. Um, let's, let's try that.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Um, and let's have a follow-up appointment, if we're finding that things are not getting better, we might need to arrange some blood tests or um, look at uh, other possibilities, but, we'll try that in the first instance.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, if anything changes in the meantime, or you get worried or things get worse. Feel free, have a lower threshold for ringing us back and <UNSURE>we can</UNSURE> book you an appointment, and we can reassess the situation.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK. Yeah, <UNSURE>the</UNSURE>, that, that sounds brilliant. Thank you so much for your help.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, no problem. So there'll be a summary of all of this in the notes. Um, and I'll also leave a link, to some of the danger signs of symptoms of headaches, in the notes. If you can read through that in your own time, that will just help you to have a bit more, control over what's going on and understanding of what, what, what kind of things, should trigger you contacting another doctor.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK. That's perfect. Thank you so much for your help.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: No problem, OK. So we'll, we'll touch base in a week's time, with me <UNSURE>or</UNSURE>, myself or one of the other doctors, and we <UNIN/>, we'll take it from there, OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK. Thank you. Yeah, I'll book an appointment, in, um, yeah, in that time.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Brilliant, OK then, all right. Take care then, <UNSURE>all the best</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>Bye</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Thank you, and you.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Bye bye.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Bye.
